roleset.name: make the characteristic noise of a cow

example.name: low-v: Bovine
example.text: The cattle lowed in the field.

roleset.note: LOW-V NOTES: Frames file for 'low' based on dictionary.com. Verbnet entry 38. (from low.01-v predicate notes)

roleset.name: be depressed, in poor spirits
roleset.note: LOW-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, comparison to high.02. (from low.02-j)

roleset.name: be unrefined, base, immoral

example.name: low-j: empty it, concatenation
example.text: Some men thought that even if Wes's accusations against Old Bill were true, it was low of him to make them after all these years.
example.arg: to make them after all these years.

roleset.note: LOW-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WordNet, FrameNet. (from low.03-j)

roleset.name: be in the lower ranges

example.name: low-j: both args
example.text: It is low in altitude compared to the rest of the mountain, being only 1200m above sea level.
example.arg: compared to the rest of the mountain,

example.name: low-j: both args
example.text: Feinberg et al. [27] found that raising and lowering the pitch of female voices by 20 Hz had a stronger effect on voices that [*]were low in pitch before being manipulated than on voices that were average-pitched or high-pitched before manipulation.

roleset.note: LOW-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, comparison to high.01. Corresponds somewhat to lower-v.01. (from low.01-j)
LOWER-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from lower.01-j)

roleset.name: cause to go down, esp of financial usage, decreasing

role.descr: Logical subject, patient, thing going down
end point, end state of arg1

example.name: lower-v: just transitive
example.text: The upgrade reflected the 20% decline in shares of the bank since the firm lowered its rating in early October, based on the belief the stock had become expensive.
example.arg: based on the belief the stock had become expensive.

example.name: lower-v: start and end points
example.text: Standard& Poor's Corp. lowered the rating on Crossland's preferred stock to double-C from single-B-minus and placed it on CreditWatch for possible further downgrade.
example.arg: the rating on Crossland's preferred stock

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: According to this plan , it was decided that Britain would use a dam in Uganda in order to lower the water level in the White Nile by seven - eighths .
example.arg: the water level in the White Nile

example.name: lower-v: With Causer
example.text: Statins also lower LDL, and so people assume that the benefit of statins is due to their lowering of LDL.

roleset.note: LOWER-V NOTES: Frames file for 'lower' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No access to verbnet. Comparison with 'drop' and similar verbs of incremental downward movement. (from lower.01-v predicate notes)
